text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: When you find yourself in darkness, remember: the sun sets and rises, but its light is eternal.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Even from a night that seems endless to the whole world, there is a path that leads into a bright morning.
author: Haruki Murakami

text: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul and sings a tune without the words, and never stops at all.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.
author: Mark Twain

text: Just one small positive thought in the morning can change your whole day.
author: Dalai Lama

text: We cannot become what we want to be by remaining what we are.
author: Max De Pree

text: There is always light, if only we are brave enough to see it. If only we are brave enough to be it.
author: Amanda Gorman

text: Don’t judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: Remind yourself that this is not a sign of weakness. It’s an illness that needs treatment, just like any other.
author: Demi Lovato

text: Don’t let your illness define who you are.
author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

text: What we see depends mainly on what we are looking for.
author: John Lubbock

text: It’s important to speak about your feelings instead of hiding them inside.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: You are not alone, and this darkness, like everything else, will pass.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

text: Courage doesn’t always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, “I will try again tomorrow.”
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

text: Hope is the thing with feathers that settles in the soul and sings a wordless melody, and never stops at all.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: Remind yourself that you don’t have to do what everyone else is doing.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Keep away from those who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the truly great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
author: Mark Twain

text: Depression is a state in which you no longer feel in charge of your own life. Find something that brings you back to living, no matter how small it may seem.
author: Andrew Solomon

text: Being strong means feeling terrible and alive at the very same time.
author: Lena Dunham

text: Your current situation is not your final destination.
author: Unknown

text: What you’re feeling right now will not define you forever.
author: Christina Rimmey

text: Hope is faith directed toward the future – the belief that better days will come, no matter how dark the present feels.
author: Unknown

text: Depression is a prison where you are both the jailer and the prisoner.
author: Dorothy Rowe

text: If you’re going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

text: The most important thing you can do when you’ve hit bottom is to start climbing back up.
author: Demi Lovato

text: Hold on to hope. In the dark, the stars are easiest to see.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Treatment doesn’t mean instant recovery, but it is the first step toward it.
author: Unknown

text: Be patient toward all that is unresolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: Mental health needs just as much attention and care as physical health.
author: Unknown

text: In every night there is a star that shines more brightly.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Don’t be afraid to show your vulnerability. Being honest about how you’re really doing can bring you the support you need.
author: Unknown

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Sometimes the healthiest thing you can do is simply allow yourself to feel.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t lose faith in yourself. You never know how close you may be to your goal.
author: Unknown

text: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Never be afraid to ask for help. It’s a sign of strength, not weakness.
author: Unknown

text: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Define your life not by what you failed to do, but by what you can still achieve.
author: Unknown

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: We become strong not by never having to struggle, but by learning to overcome the challenges we face.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t wait for special moments – make every moment special.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t worry about what people think of you. They’re too busy thinking about themselves.
author: Unknown

text: Any step forward, even the smallest one, is a step toward success.
author: Unknown

text: Do not be afraid of going slowly; be afraid only of standing still.
author: Chinese proverb

text: True courage is knowing you will wake up tomorrow even when it feels like your whole world collapsed today.
author: Unknown

text: Remember that not getting what you want is sometimes a wonderful stroke of luck.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

text: Happiness is not having what you want, but wanting what you have.
author: Unknown

text: Success is the ability to go from one failure to another without losing enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your life magnificent.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Only those who risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
author: T. S. Eliot

text: Pain is not always a call to action; sometimes it is an invitation to be still and reflect.
author: Unknown

text: Real optimism is not cheerfulness but strength – the power to face reality with your eyes wide open.
author: Unknown

text: Every day is a new opportunity to change your life.
author: Unknown

text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
author: Amelia Earhart
